chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
items.plainText: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

items.text: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.
items.plainText: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

items.text: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)
items.plainText: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)

items.text: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
items.plainText: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

items.text: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.
items.plainText: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

items.text: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.
items.plainText: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.

items.text: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
items.plainText: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

items.text: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.
items.plainText: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

items.text: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
items.plainText: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

items.text: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.
items.plainText: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

items.text: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.
items.plainText: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

items.text: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.
items.plainText: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

items.text: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
items.plainText: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.

items.text: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
items.plainText: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

items.text: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.
items.plainText: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

items.text: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
items.plainText: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.

items.text: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?
items.plainText: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

items.text: I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?
items.plainText: I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?

items.text: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.
items.plainText: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

items.text: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:
items.plainText: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

items.text: And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
items.plainText: And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
